newsitem.title: USA: Koll says court ruling will delay project.
newsitem.headline: Koll says court ruling will delay project.

text.p: Koll Real Estate Group Inc Monday said a court ruling, handed down July, will delay infrastructure construction at the Bolsa Chica real estate development until 1998's second quarter.
In a statement, the real estate company said it believes the ruling, however, will not permanently prevent its planned development there.
Last Thursday, San Diego Superior Court ruled the entire Bolsa Chica Local Coastal Program be returned to a state commission for further review based on two issues, Koll said.
The issues are whether proposed homes in the lowlands comply with the California Coastal Act and whether filling of a pond complies with the act.
Koll said the first issue -- the proposed homes -- applies to other developers, while the pond issue applies to Koll.

Koll could process plans directly through the commission or the County of Orange, Calif., with commission review. But the county permits would be subject to appeal by the Coastal Commission, resulting in increased processing time.
Koll said it is currently weighing options for dealing with the ruling, including possibly filing an appeal.
